intro: Symphytum cycladense, commonly known as Cycladic comfrey, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves and showy blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas. Its roots contain allantoin, which has been historically used in traditional medicine for its soothing properties. The plant is also valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in various environmental conditions.
